intro: Theodorea serrulatodes, commonly known as the serrulate theodorea, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink and white. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure. Theodorea serrulatodes requires well-drained soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
